title: The Dimension of a Vector Space

sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: What’s up! I’m Jihad Al Sayed, and today we’re talking about dimension — one of the simplest yet most powerful ideas in linear algebra. Let’s break down what it really means for a vector space.

sections.title: What is Dimension?
sections.content: The dimension of a vector space is the number of vectors in a basis for that space. It tells you how many directions you need to describe every vector in the space.

sections.title: Dimension of Subspaces
sections.content: Every subspace has a dimension ≤ the space it’s inside. For example, a plane in ℝ³ has dimension 2.

sections.title: Rank-Nullity Connection
sections.math: \text{dim(Col A)} + \text{dim(Null A)} = \text{number of columns of A}

sections.title: Why It Matters
sections.content: Dimension tells you how complex your data or system is. It's critical in ML, computer vision, physics simulations — even search engines.

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: Today we explored what dimension is, how to find it, and why it's such a fundamental measure of structure in any vector space you’ll encounter.
